formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2) - a(n-4) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 6, a[1] == 8, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2] + 1/2]}, a, {n, 0, 50}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Exy:=[6,8]; [n le 2 select Exy[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2) + 1/2): n in [1..50]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016
crossrefs: It appears that this is a subsequence of A023434.
See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _David W. Wilson_
